frameDefinitions: Two (or more) people (the Parties, also encodable as Party_1 and Party_2) negotiate an agreement.
Item-1 and Item-2 are compatible with each other if they can exist or function together in some context without problems, conflict, or other undesirable situation.
Two (or more) people (the Interlocutors, also encodable as Interlocutor_1 and Interlocutor_2) talk to one another.
The Cognizers have a similarity (or dissimilarity) in their Opinion.
In this frame an Ingestor takes a Substance into his or her body.
Two (or more) people (the Parties, also encodable as Party_1 and Party_2) have an agreement.
frameExamples: So far , we have <t>agreed</t>to cede 100km of coastline to Kiribati . DNI
Make sure your site is <t>compatible</t> with any browser.
I would rather <t>discuss</t> politics with anyone but him.
Dr. Gerry and Mr. Pond <t>agree</t> in their impressions.
You should refrain from <t>taking</t> vodka up the nose.
The US and Russia have an <t>agreement</t> to share early warning data on missile launches.
listRoleDefinitions:
The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e.
agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is,
<fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and
peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself
generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.

The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or
group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded
within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with).
An expression of the commitment made by the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered.
The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in making an agreement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> where the Agreement occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Agreement occurs.
The Frame Element <fen>Item_1</fen> marks the grammatically more prominent of the two entities, i.e.the subject in active clauses, when they are expressed separately.
The Frame Element <fen>Item_2</fen> marks the grammatically less prominent of the <fen>Items</fen> when they are expressed separately.
This role is used when the <fen>Items</fen> are expressed jointly in a phrase, either a plural or a coordinated NP.
This Frame Element is used for expressions that indicate a <fen>Parameter</fen> or respect in which the <fen>Items</fen> are said to be compatible, not in conflict.

In cases where the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, this role identifies the conversational participant with greater semantic and syntactic prominence, as compared with <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen> is generally encoded as Subject, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>.  Thus a <fen>Purpose</fen> (or <fen>Means</fen>, <fen>Depictive</fen>, or <fen>Manner</fen>) is construed to be that of <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Interlocutors</fen> as a whole.

In cases where the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> refers to the semantically and grammatically less prominent group.  It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by <ment>with</ment>).  Note that it is possible for a single role to correspond to multiple referents. For example, if the prepositional object in the example below were plural, we would still assign it the single role <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>.

In some sentences both participants are expressed by the Subject, and there is no 'with'-phrase (cf example 1). In sentences like this, the Subject is assigned the role role <fen>Interlocutors</fen>. In such sentences, the Subject always denotes more than one person, and it is understood that the reciprocal communication takes place between these two (or more) people. The Subject may denote two or more people either through conjunction, as in example 1, or through plurality, as in example 2, or by denoting a group, as in example 3. In each of these cases the role <fen>Interlocutors</fen> is assigned. Notice that for nouns in the Discussion frame, it is possible for the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> role to be expressed by a prepositional phrase as in example 4.

<fen>Topic</fen> expresses the subject that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> are trying to come to some agreement about.  It may refer, for example, to an undesirable issue that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> want to have the proper response to, or it may refer more directly to an unresolved question.
The time at which the discussion takes place.
The location at which a discussion takes place.
This role marks constituents that express the set of <fen>Cognizers</fen> whose similarity of opinion is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Cognizer_1</fen> is the individual characterized by their similarity in opinion to <fen>Cognizer_2</fen>, whose opinion is assumed to be known.  <fen>Cognizer_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Cognizer_2</fen> is the one whose opinion is assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing the opinion of <fen>Cognizer_1</fen>.

This role denotes an implicit question in response to which the <fen>Cognizers</fen> give their <fen>Opinion</fen>s, which are then assessed for their similarity.  The <fen>Question</fen> may concern the identitiy of a particular entity, as in the first example below, or it may be of the yes/no-type, as in the second example below.
A state of affairs believed by the <fen>Cognizers</fen>.
A phenomenon that the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are considering with respect to their <fen>Opinion</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are in agreement or disagreement.
The Place is the general area in which the Cognizers are in agreement or disagreement.
The <fen>Delivery_device</fen> is the means by which the <fen>Substance</fen> is ingested.
The <fen>Ingestor</fen> ingests the <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the drug or other substance that is ingested by the <fen>Ingestor</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Ingestor</fen> ingests the <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Ingestor</fen> ingests the <fen>Substance</fen>.

The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e. agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.
The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with).
An expression of the commitment of the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered by the agreement.
The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in having an agreement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the agreement was made.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an agreement was made.
listRoleExamples: On Monday, <fex>the airline</fex> reached a deal with the Canadian Auto Workers.
Mozilla Foundation has finally reached an agreement <fex>with America Online</fex>.
The US and Russia have agreed <fex>to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.
Some types of alloy steel have been covered in the expiring <fex>trade</fex> agreement.
<fex>The US and Russia</fex> have agreed to cooperate in destroying surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.
The town coucil members finally reached an agreement <fex>at midnight</fex>.
The town coucil members reached an agreement <fex>at the City Hall plenary session</fex>.
<fex>That technology</fex> turned out not to be compatible with the existing devices
My computer is not compatible <fex>with my new printer</fex>.
<fex>Your socks</fex> don't match.
The two applications are compatible <fex>in their essential features</fex>.
<fex>The President</fex> conferred with his top advisor.
The President debated <fex>with his top advisor</fex>.
(1) <fex>The President and his advisor</fex> discussed the Venezuelan situation briefly before the summit.
The President and his top advisors discussed <fex>the scandal</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex> the participants discussed taking down the last trade barriers without consensus.
We just conferred for a couple of hours <fex>up in her room</fex>.
I think we see eye to eye <fex>in our ultimate goal</fex>, which is that we want to see a democratic Serbia.
We agree <fex>that babies should not be dropped from helicopters</fex>.
Tabitha smoked <fex>a pipe</fex>.
<fex>AOL 's</fex> agreement with the ACLU will soon expire , and renogotiation is not a real possibility .
Mozilla Foundation now has a bindingagreement <fex>with America Online</fex>.
The US and Russia have an agreement <fex>to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.
Some types of alloy steel have been covered in the expiring <fex>trade</fex> agreement.
<fex>The US and Russia</fex> have an agreement to cooperate in destroying surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.
The missile agreement <fex>of 1952</fex> was still in force, however.
The <fex>Kyoto</fex> treaty has so far been relatively ineffectual.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the International Union of Pure and Applied Physics
